agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides guardianship intervention services for elders who are actively being exploited financially, abused, or neglected, and for those at imminent risk of being so.
service_description: Serves as the guardian for an incapacitated adult. A volunteer then maintains regular contact with the incapacitated adult, directs their health care, attends and/or participates in care plan conferences to ensure health care services are appropriate and that the services maximize the incapacitated person's quality of life.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Incapacitated adults , age 18 or older -- Hospitalized patients -- Nursing home patients -- Outpatients and end-of-life patients in crisis -- Physician's report stating care required due to mental or medical incapacity -- No suitable or willing relative or other significant person to serve as guardian -- Madison County Probate Court determined a guardian is needed

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Ingalls in Madison County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Ingalls in Madison County.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Madison County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; Serves the town of Ingalls in Madison County.

site_details: Call for more information about dates of enrollment assistance.

site_eligibility: Limit of one package per child -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to build stronger communities through child abuse prevention, home-based services, youth placement, and recovery services.
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY (CPCS) - REGION 11
service_description: Provides a home-based child abuse and neglect prevention program to Hamilton, Hancock, Madison, and Tipton County families with children. Services are tailored to meet each individual family's needs and may include case management, advocacy, parent education, and referrals to community resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS), or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open juvenile probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to build stronger communities through child abuse prevention, home-based services, youth placement, and recovery services.
service_description: Offers parenting classes for parents of children of any ages. Topics include family development and developing healthy relationships.
site_details: Call or text to register.

site_schedule.schedule: Office: Tues 10am-6pm; Wed 2pm-6pm; Fri 9am-1pm -- Parenting Classes: Vary

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing referrals for mental health, drug, and alcohol recovery services.
service_description: Offers 24-hour telephone helpline for individuals in life altering situations due to addictions or mental illnesses in Madison County.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Individuals in need of assistance due to addiction or mental illness.

agency_desc: A commercial organization providing an inpatient substance use treatment facility for men.
service_description: Provides an inpatient treatment program for men. Services include substance use treatment, mental healthcare, Medication-Assisted Treatment (MAT), peer support groups, and education and skills training.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Visit website or call for information. -- Visit website to start and online application; agency will contact to schedule an admission interview.

site_schedule.name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities

site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Individuals seeking inpatient residential treatment for drug or alcohol use -- Submit to frequent, random drug and alcohol screening -- Mentally and physically able to participate in program -- Agree to follow rules and guidelines -- Willing to participate in recovery -- Primary issue must be substance abuse or dependency -- Provide release documentation if coming from hospital or detox facility -- Able to pay for all program fees and/or actively seeking insurance and state residential fee coverage -- Medically detoxed prior to arrival

agency_desc: We hope to provide a warm, safe, multipurpose center that promotes and provides quality activities and services that will contribute to the emotional, moral, and social well-being of the community.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food items to those in need.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides information and advocacy to those who have experienced domestic violence, human trafficking, prostitution, or sexual exploitation.
service_description: Provides information, education, and advocacy for women who are current or previous victims of domestic violence, human trafficking, prostitution, or sexual exploitation. Guidance and support services are provided to restore confidence, self worth, and love. Referrals to community resources are offered to empower women in transition of a new life path.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Women -- Recovering from violence, exploitation, sex trafficking or sexual exploitation

agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
site_name: CENTRAL INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - MADISON COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Madison County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Application process is currently CLOSED. Local media will announce when the wait list opens. -- People already on the wait list, call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides primary medical care, behavioral health, addictions services, and programs addressing social determinants of health.
site_name: KIDS TALK ASPIRE CHILD ADVOCACY CENTER
service_description: Provides a safe and welcoming place for kids to report abuse or violence, bringing the system to the child by providing a single location for interviewing and facilitate the healing process for the child.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit www.aspireindiana.org/community-programs/kids-talk for more information.
site_eligibility: Children 18 or younger who have been a victim of abuse or violence

agency_desc: An incorporated nonprofit agency which "strives to eradicate domestic and sexual violence through education, prevention, and intervention in Central Indiana." Alternatives Inc. supports survivors through the initial crisis with the ultimate strategy of helping them achieve abuse-free and financially independent lives.
service_description: Provides emergency housing and supportive services for survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking (and dependents) experiencing crisis and in need of immediate assistance. Services for this short-term program include meals, case management, and advocacy. Crisis line available 24 hours per day.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking with or without dependents living in Hamilton, Hancock, Henry, Madison, Marion, and Tipton Counties
Enrollment in these programs is subject to unit availability and participant eligibility -- Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking with or without dependents
Survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, or human trafficking with or without dependents living or working in Madison County

agency_desc: A multi-state nonprofit organization bringing human services to people and communities in eleven states.
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided within set boundaries.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Ages 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level -OR- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI). -- Note: Other special circumstances (such as disabilities) may be considered.

agency_desc: A multi-state nonprofit organization bringing human services to people and communities in eleven states.
service_description: Provides prenatal and early childhood support through a home-based program that combines parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services for low-income families.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers with children up to age 3 -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level -- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI). -- Other special circumstances may be considered.

agency_desc: A nonprofit network of hospitals and other health and medical services providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bipolar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, and supported employment services are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Central Intake to schedule an assessment. For crisis intervention, call the Crisis Line.
site_eligibility: Age 5 and older -- In need of outpatient mental health services (based on assessment)
Open; patients age 18 or younger must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, and St Joseph County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Delaware, Fayette, Henry, Madison, Randolph, Rush, Union, and Wayne County.

agency_desc: A faith-based organization with a mission "to provide compassionate Rescue services on an immediate and/or long-term basis to the poor and needy of Muncie and East Central Indiana."
site_name: MUNCIE MISSION MINISTRIES - WOMEN'S TRANSITIONAL HOME - ALEXANDRIA
service_description: Provides transitional housing for low-income women who are homeless. This is not an emergency shelter and admission takes 7-14 days to complete. Supportive services, including case management and self-help classes, are available. Residents are required to attend a place of worship of their choice. Typical length of stay is 6-18 months.
site_details: Call or visit website www.munciemission.org/womens-services to download application. -- Complete application and submit by mail, e-mail, or in person. -- Participate in an interview process and take a drug test at director's discretion.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- Employable -- With or without children -- No male children over age 11 -- Willing to participate in all classes, off-site services, and community service weekly -- Willing to continue current services provided by other agencies -- 30 days clean from drug and alcohol use/abuse and actively pursuing recovery
